results.title: The Delian problem (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jean Nunn, Neil Cleminson, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Mathematics”.
Examines the problem of duplicating the cube, which amounts to finding the cubic root of 2 and is known as the Delian problem. Discusses the reformation of this problem in terms of finding two mean proportionals and the solution of the simpler problem of one mean proportional.

results.title: His responsibility?
results.brief_description: Ronnie aged 18, learns that his girlfriend is pregnant. Abortion? Illegitimacy? Keeping the baby? Adoption? Marriage? He must decide what his responsibility is. This film helps teenagers preview the consequences of irresponsible actions, as they affect themselves and others.

results.title: His own kind of dignity
results.brief_description: Looks at the problems of some developing countries, namely the Philippines, Indonesia and Papua-New Guinea. Explores some development programmes assisted by foreign aid from Asia Fund for Human Development. Narrated by Peter Bergin.

results.title: Himachal
results.creator_credit: N.S. Thapa, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: A portrait of Himachal Pradesh State and its progress in recent years. Snowbound in winter the valleys awake in spring, when the sheep are shorn for their fine carpet wools, and the crops are planted. Isolation which has held back the development of Himachal Pradesh is being broken down by the building of the Hindustan Tibet highway. Life of the village people Mandi, where pilgrims flock to the ancient temple; traditions of religion, art and folkdance; orchards, timber and potatoes as increasing valuable products; snow sports in winter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: N.S. Thapa, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: High-speed motion picture of the human vocal chords
results.brief_description: Speech, to the telephone engineer, is a commodity that must be picked up in one place and delivered promptly, cheaply and in good condition to another. For a number of years members of the Bell Telephone Laboratories have been investigating the properties of speech and this film shows the use of high-speed motion picture photography in this important area.

results.title: High pressure drums
results.brief_description: A detailed account of the manufacture of high pressure boiler drums in one of Britain’s leading engineering works. Scenes of the installation of drums during the construction of a new atomic power plant show one of the many fields of industry in which this article is an essential component.

results.title: The Hidden land
results.creator_credit: N.S. Thapa, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: All along India’s northern frontier run the Himalayas, a formidable chain of snow-clad mountains and glacial valleys. Clothed in this cold and glittering mantle lies the kingdom of Bhutan, remote and mystic. This film is a study of this neighbouring kingdom, its people and their art and culture. Narrated by Berkeley Hill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: N.S. Thapa, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Here's help
results.creator_credit: Mike Mansfield, James Berry and Associated Film Consultants
results.brief_description: Surveys the drug scene in America and the treatment now available. Stresses that people’s own inadequacies and problems lead to drug taking which can be regarded as a social sickness. Lists types of help available from a variety of organisations. Includes comments from addicts and parents whose children have taken drugs.

results.title: Heredity in animals
results.brief_description: The chromosomes in cell nuclei and their relation to the genes for the inherited characters of an animal, the processes of mitosis and meiosis, and the formation of gametes are explained by animated diagrams. Mendel’s first law of segregation and dominance are illustrated. When more than one pair of genes are involved, it is shown how they segregate independently. Cross breeding illustrates the emergence in the second generation of a new type. Results of selective breeding of horses and dogs are also shown.
